verses.verse: BOOK 2PSALM 42Thirsting for God in Trouble and Exile.For the music director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah. (Possibly Contemplative; or Didactic; or Skillful Psalm) As the deer (Lit longs for) pants for the water brooks, So my soul (Lit longs for) pants for You, God.
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God; When shall I come and (Some mss see the face of God) appear before God?
My tears have been my food day and night, While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”

I remember these things and pour out my soul within me. For I used to go over with the multitude and walk them to the house of God, With a voice of joy and thanksgiving, a multitude celebrating a festival.

Why are you (Lit dissolved away) in despair, my soul? And why are you restless within me? Wait for God, for I will (Or still) again praise (Some ancient versions Him, the help of my face and my God) Him For the (Or saving acts of) help of His (Or presence. O my God, my soul...) presence, my God.
My soul is (Or dissolved away) in despair within me; Therefore I remember You from the land of the Jordan And the (Lit Hermons) peaks of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
Deep calls to deep at the sound of Your waterfalls; All Your breakers and Your waves have passed over me.
The LORD will send His goodness in the daytime; And His song will be with me in the night, A prayer to the God of my life.
I will say to God my rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I go about mourning (Or while the enemy oppresses) because of the oppression of the enemy?”
As a shattering of my bones, my adversaries taunt me, While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”

Why are you (Or dissolved away) in despair, my soul? And why are you restless within me? Wait for God, for I will again praise (As in some ancient mss, cf. v 5; MT Him, the help of my face and my God) Him For the (Or saving acts of) help of His presence, my God.
